contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Metro zocalo.png|60px|left|Station logo]] '''Metro Zócalo''' is a [[metro station|station]] on [[Mexico City Metro Line 2|Line 2]] of the [[Mexico City Metro]] system.<ref name="metro">{{Cite web|url=http://www.metro.df.gob.mx/red/estacion.html?id=33|title=Zócalo|language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|publisher=[[Sistema de Transporte Colectivo]]|accessdate=17 August 2011}}</ref><ref name="archambault">{{Cite web|last=Archambault|first=Richard|url=http://mexicometro.org/metro/line2/zocalo/|title=Zócalo » Mexico City Metro System|accessdate=17 August 2011}}</ref> It is located in the [[Historic center of Mexico City|Colonia Centro]] district of the [[Cuauhtémoc, D.F.|Cuauhtémoc]] borough exactly on the heart of [[Mexico City]].<ref name="metro"/> The station serves the main central square, known as the ''[[Zócalo]]'', but formally called the "[[Plaza de la Constitución]]" (Constitution Square).<ref name="metro"/> The station logo shows the [[Coat of Arms of Mexico|Mexican Coat of Arms]], which is also the Presidential Seal.<ref name="metro"/> Artwork on the walls of the station reflects the evolution of the central square over time. Three large [[display case]]s contain miniature models showing the site during three periods in history starting from the [[Aztec]] pyramids until the present day. Buildings surrounding the square include the [[Metropolitan Cathedral, Mexico City|Metropolitan Cathedral]], [[Palacio Nacional]], where the [[List of Presidents of Mexico|President]]'s office is located, and the Mexico City Town Hall.<ref name="metro"/> The station opened on 14 September 1970.<ref name="monroy_history">{{Cite web|last=Monroy|first=Marco|editor-last=Schwandl|editor-first=Robert|url=http://www.urbanrail.net/am/mexi/mex-history.htm|title=Opening Dates for Mexico City's Subway|accessdate=17 August 2011}}</ref> Zócalo station has an information desk and a cultural display.<ref name="metro"/> It connects with the [[Metro Pino Suárez]] station at the south side through a long underground passage, called Pasaje Zócalo–Pino Suárez.<ref name="paseo_los_libros">{{Cite web|url=http://www.unpaseoporloslibros.com/|title=Un paseo por los libros ::. Pasaje Zócalo - Pino Suárez|language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|accessdate=18 August 2011}}</ref><ref name="educal">{{Cite web|url=http://www.educal.gob.mx/directoriolibrerias/centro/76-pasaje-zocalo-pino-suarez-df|title=Pasaje Zócalo-Pino Suárez, D.F.|language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|accessdate=18 August 2011}}</ref><ref name="sep_la_jornada">{{Cite web|url=http://www.sep.gob.mx/wb/sep1/S12JOR150410|title=El pasaje Zócalo-Pino Suárez se suma a la celebración por el Día Mundial del Libro|publisher=[[La Jornada]] as reproduced by the Secretaría de Educación Pública|language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|accessdate=18 August 2011}}</ref><ref name="hernandez">{{Cite news|last=García Hernández|first=Arturo|url=http://www.jornada.unam.mx/2010/04/15/index.php?section=cultura&article=a05n1cul|title=El pasaje Zócalo-Pino Suárez se suma a la celebración por el Día Mundial del Libro|work=[[La Jornada]]|page=5|date=15 April 2010|language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|accessdate=18 August 2011}}</ref> This corridor is filled mostly with bookstores, and also has a free mini-cinema. The two underground entrances leading to the station are not signposted as is usually the case with other stations in the network. <gallery> Image:MetroZocaloHall.JPG|One of the hallways leading into Metro Zocalo Image:Modelpre1521MetroZoc.JPG|Model of the sacred precinct of Tenochtitlan prior to the Spanish conquest of 1521 on display in the Metro station Image:ModelMexicoCity1824.JPG|Model of Mexico City as it appeared in 1824 on display in the station </gallery> == See also == * [[List of Mexico City metro stations]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == {{Commons category|Zócalo (station)|position=left}} {{s-rail-start}} {{s-rail|title=Mexico City Metro}} {{s-line|system=Mexico City Metro|line=2|previous=Allende|next=Pino Suárez}} {{s-end}} {{MxMetro2}} {{Coord|19.433248|N|99.1329|W|region:MX-DIF_type:railwaystation|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Metro Zocalo}} [[Category:Mexico City metro stations|Zocalo]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1970]] {{Mexico-metro-stub}}
